arez.ticker

Class IntervalTicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • arez.ticker.IntervalTicker

  • @ArezComponent
public abstract class IntervalTicker
extends Object
    An Observable model that "ticks" at a specified interval. The tick is actually updating the "tickTime" observable property. The ticks are only generated when there is an observer of the property so there should be no significant performance impact if there is no observers.

    A very simple example

    
 import com.google.gwt.core.client.EntryPoint;
 import elemental2.dom.DomGlobal;
 import arez.Arez;
 import arez.ticker.IntervalTicker;

 public class IntervalTickerExample
   implements EntryPoint
 {
   public void onModuleLoad()
   {
     final IntervalTicker ticker = IntervalTicker.create( 1000 );
     Arez.context().autorun( () -> DomGlobal.console.log( "Tick: " + ticker.getTickTime() ) );
   }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • create

        @Nonnull
public static IntervalTicker create(long interval)
        Create a ticker for specified interval.
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval to tick at in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the IntervalTicker.

      • getInterval

        @Observable
public long getInterval()
        Return the interval that the ticker ticks at in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the interval that the ticker ticks at in milliseconds.

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval(long interval)
        Specify the interval that the ticker ticks at in milliseconds. This will restart the ticker if there is an observer watching the ticks and thus is safe to call at any time. Howevwer, it will reset the last tick time to now.
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval that the ticker ticks at in milliseconds. Must be a positive value.

      • getTickTime

        @Computed
public long getTickTime()
        Return the time that the ticker last ticked. If there is no observers yet, the last tick time will be now and the interval timer will start.
        Returns:
        the time that the ticker last ticked.
